basics.name: David Baumgold
basics.label: Full-Stack Web Developer
basics.summary:
I'm a full-stack web developer with a passion for clean, readable code. Python and JavaScript are my tools of choice.

I'm an open sourcerer. I believe that sharing knowledge benefits everyone, and that community is more important than code.

I'm a technical trainer and public speaker. I have a knack for explaining complicated topics in an approachable manner, and I'm not afraid to do so in front of an audience.

work.summary: Currently working as a freelance consultant, helping companies develop robust and maintainable websites using Python and JavaScript.

Organized and assisted the open source community in their efforts to use the software; organized major software releases, advocated for documentation and features specific to the community’s use. Spoke about Open edX at conferences, and helped organize the Open edX Conference.
highlights: Developed a bot for automating parts of the pull request review process, saving thousands of hours of developer productivity
Managed the release process for the Open edX software

work.summary: Open source Python/Django web application with Backbone.js frontend. Lead development of major components of the application, as well as spearheading major code-cleanup and refactoring efforts in an agile, Scrum-based workflow.
highlights: Turned a messy JavaScript codebase into a modular one using require.js

work.summary: Python web application running on Google App Engine. Assisted with a major architectural restructuring to work with App Engine’s eventually-consistent datastore. Increased developer productivity through communication, education, tooling, and automated testing.

PHP web application with a dynamic Javascript front-end, integrated into a Java codebase. Worked as a full-stack developer in a small, agile team, fixing bugs and adding features in many different levels of the codebase.
